sdm.epidemic.examples.A
Class Node

java.lang.Object
  simsim.core.AbstractNode
      sdm.epidemic.examples.A.Node
All Implemented Interfaces:
ExtendedMessageHandler, MessageHandler
public class Node
extends AbstractNode
implements ExtendedMessageHandler

This class is used to simulate an autonomous node of a Distributed System. Each node acts independently and schedules tasks to simulate parallel execution. IMPORTANT. You must not use threads; only tasks and periodic tasks can be used to simulate concurrency in the simulator. In this example, all nodes but one start healthy; the infected node is chosen at random, at the beginning of the simulation. In every node, a periodic task executes every second. In healthy nodes, this task does nothing until they become infected. When that happens, every time the task is executed, the node will send an InfectNode message to another node, chosen randomly, to infect it. This is more than enough to cause the infection to spread quickly. Healthy nodes in the system are represented as green dots in the Main simulator window. Infected nodes are represented in red. Every time the simulation window is updated, the simulator also draws the message traffic observed in that period.

Author:
SÃ©rgio Duarte (smd@di.fct.unl.pt)
